summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Environmental Commission of Dallas is convening for a regular meeting on November 13, 2024, at 5:30 p.m. in the Dallas City Hall, 6ES Council Briefing Room, with a videoconference option available. The purpose of the meeting is to discuss environmental policies, updates, and initiatives affecting the city.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
1. Approval of minutes from previous meetings (September 11 and October 9, 2024).
2. Briefing on the Comprehensive Environmental & Climate Action Plan (CECAP) Annual Report.
3. Discussion on an Off-Street Parking and Loading Code Amendment.

**Important Details**:  
- The CECAP Annual Report will be presented by key staff from the Office of Environmental Quality & Sustainability, highlighting progress and future goals.
- The proposed Off-Street Parking and Loading Code Amendment aims to enhance urban planning and sustainability efforts in Dallas.

**Action Items**:  
- Approval of the 2025 Meeting Calendar.
- Updates from various subcommittees, including Environmental Health and Environmental Justice, will be discussed.
- Commissioners will provide monthly district updates.
- The commission will seek input and approval on the discussed items, including the CECAP report and code amendment.

The meeting will also include public speakers and announcements, and a video stream will be available post-meeting. Participants wishing to speak must register in advance.
